Hariri and the presence of Hezbollah
07 Nov 2019, 04:47 by Lebanon 24
Gebran Bassil, the head of the Free Patriotic Movement, will return to be a minister in the new government. This is not a matter for Hezbollah as much as it is for President Michel Aoun. When Prime Minister Saad Hariri presented the question of whether Bassil would return to the government, or before the resignation of the government, Hariri asked Hizbullah: Do you accept a government that does not have a prime minister? The answer was: "Don't try to embarrass us. Ask the president that Hezbollah has no invitation. But what matters to Hariri is to ask him, apart from Tazir Bassil or anyone else, whether the party will participate in the government or not?" Will he call it the party to head the new government or a replacement? This is the issue on which Hezbollah has not yet decided. Hizbullah seems to prefer to leave its position to announce it on the day of the parliamentary consultation and not before, and it usually avoids burning its cards while waiting for everyone to disclose their papers. It is at the heart of the ongoing consultations. He was very strong during Hariri's meeting with Bassil, who put them in the details of the meeting and the discussion points, and during the meeting of resigned Finance Minister Ali Hassan Khalil also with Hariri. So, through Bassil and Speaker Nabih Berri, Hezbollah participates in the consultations, as well as communicating Based with Hariri, even through delegates. There is nothing to prevent a direct meeting but what is important is the objective and negotiations are ongoing and the fundamental question: Where can the negotiations lead? There are two fixed issues in the subject of the next government: first, will Hariri be prime minister? "It is clear that Hariri does not want anyone else to head the government, and what is said and announced is another maneuver that may not convince many," the senior political source adds on March 8. It is in the interest of Hariri to be prime minister for several reasons "not to say that he is obliged to return the Americans want" who require any future government to be divided between the "March 8 and 14" so that the representation of "Lebanese forces" and "battalions" parallel to the current share Since his resignation, Hariri has tended to break the existing political equation that emerged from the results of the parliamentary elections and led to a majority representation in favor of Hezbollah, Amal, the Free Patriotic Movement and their allies, which reflected itself within the cabinet. Who noticed that Hariri's political movement tried to exploit the rightful demands of the popular movement? In any future government. Hariri wants to reconstitute political power by telling Hizballah and its allies that the street is moving against your orientations and must be aligned with its demands, so that a government is formed technocrats or independent or close to the parties. Such a proposal represents an attempt to remove Hizbullah from the government. Presidents Aoun and Berri will not approve it, considering that any government or political equation cannot be established without Hezbollah. This does not mean that Hizbullah will reject the technocrat government or have decided its final position on it, but any proposal for a government without Hizbullah will put it at the center of the American project to get it out of the government, or even the political equation as a whole if possible. Hizbullah and its allies refuse to cause any imbalance in the balance of power that resulted from the parliamentary elections, and talk about the government and the conditions that it declares are of little value to them.
